text: Shantha Mayadunne (; 4 April 1951 â€“ 21 April 2019) was a Sri Lankan chef, writer and television personality. ==Career== She had thirty years of experience in cooking and became one of the most popular Sri Lankan television chefs.ABC News Australia, 22 April 2019, Shantha Mayadunne, TV chef, killed in Sri Lanka attacks just minutes after Easter breakfast selfie She learned how to cook in Australia, the United Kingdom, Singapore, Thailand and India. As her popularity grew, she started to teach classes through workshops and mass media programs. She published two books, the first in 2001 and the second in 2005. ==Death== She was killed on 21 April 2019 by a suicide bomber during a series of terrorist attacks in Sri Lanka. Her daughter was also killed in the attacks when both of them stayed at the Shangri-La Hotel, Colombo for breakfast.
